titleStmt.title: A remarkable letter of Mary Howgill to Oliver Cromwell, called Protector a copy whereof was delivered by her self to his own hands some moneths ago, with whom she had face to face a large discourse thereupon : unto which is annexed a paper of hers to the inhabitants of the town of Dover.
titleStmt.author: Howgill, Mary.

titleStmt.title: A remarkable letter of Mary Howgill to Oliver Cromwell, called Protector a copy whereof was delivered by her self to his own hands some moneths ago, with whom she had face to face a large discourse thereupon : unto which is annexed a paper of hers to the inhabitants of the town of Dover.
titleStmt.author: Howgill, Mary.
Cromwell, Oliver, 1599-1658.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and are to be sold at the Black Spread-Eagle at the west-end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Written by Mary Howgill. Cf. BM.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
